member.summary: Gets or sets the axis position (zone) the axis is placed into

member.summary: Specifies spacing of the level before the other levels in the zone (if any)
member.remarks: This property takes effect only when the property CreateNewZoneLevel is set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDockCartesianAxisAnchor.AfterSpace
member.summary: Specifies spacing that should be leaved after the level of the axis before other levels are added in the zone.
member.remarks: This property takes effect only when the property CreateNewZoneLevel is set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDockCartesianAxisAnchor.CreateNewZoneLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this anchor will create a new zone level for the axis or use the last created one.
member.remarks: If there are no levels in the zone the anchor will always create a zone level. Note that the BeforeSpace and AfterSpace properties depend on the value of this property.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDockPolarAxisAnchor.AfterSpace
member.summary: Specifies spacing that should be leaved after the level of the axis before other levels are added in the zone.
member.remarks: This property takes effect only when the property CreateNewZoneLevel is set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDockPolarAxisAnchor.CreateNewZoneLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this anchor will create a new zone level for the axis or use the last created one.
member.remarks: If there are no levels in the zone the anchor will always create a zone level. Note that the BeforeSpace and AfterSpace properties depend on the value of this property.

The local value of this property is automatically cleared to its default false, when the computed value of the Enabled property is true. In this way you can select disabled widgets via styling, by using the ValueEqualsCondition

member.summary: Controls the width of the candle in model units.
member.remarks: By default set to 2.5f.

member.summary: Whether the candle width should be scaled when the user zooms in on the chart

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NStockSeries.ShowOpen
member.summary: Controls the visibility of the Open value.
member.remarks: Valid if CandleShape is Stick. By default set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NStockSeries.ShowClose
member.summary: Controls the visibility of the Close value.
member.remarks: Valid if CandleShape is Stick. By default set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NStockSeries.ShowHighLow
member.summary: Controls the visibility of the line connecting High and Low values.
member.remarks: By default set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NStockSeries.UpFill
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill style applied to the up candles.
member.remarks: The up candles are displayed with this fill style.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NStockSeries.UpStroke
member.summary: Gets or sets the stroke style applied to the up Candle and Stick.
member.remarks: The up candles borders are displayed with this stroke style.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NStockSeries.DownFill
member.summary: Get or sets the fill style applied to the down Candle.
member.remarks: The down candles are displayed with this fill style.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NStockSeries.DownStroke
member.summary: Get or sets the stroke style applied to the down Candle and Stick.
member.remarks: The down candles borders are displayed with this stroke style.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NStockSeries.UpHighLowStroke
member.summary: Gets or sets the stroke style applied to the high low line of up oriented candles.
member.remarks: This stroke style is applied if the CandleShape is set to Candle.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NStockSeries.DownHighLowStroke
member.summary: Gets or sets a stroke style applied to the high low line of downward oriented candles.
member.remarks: This stroke style is applied if the CandleShape is set to Candle.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDataLabelStyle.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new data label with default settings.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDataLabelStyle.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new data label with the specified visibility

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDataLabelStyle.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new data label with the specified format

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDataLabelStyle.Visible
member.summary: Controls the visibility of the data label.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDataLabelStyle.VertAlign
member.summary: Controls the vertical data label alignment relative to the data point bound.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDataLabelStyle.ArrowLength
member.summary: Controls the length of the arrow connecting the data point and the text label.
member.remarks: By default set to 4.0f.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDataLabelStyle.ArrowPointerLength
member.summary: Controls the length of the arrow pointer pointing to the data label text.
member.remarks: By default set to 0. Note that not all series data points have arrow pointers. Currently only the pie series in spider mode use this value.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDataLabelStyle.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format string of the data labels.
member.remarks: With the help of the format string you can specify what content must be displayed in the data labels. The formatting commands depend on the series.

member.summary: Gets or sets the text style applied to the data labels.

member.summary: Gets or sets the stroke style applied to the data label arrows.

member.name: T:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NChartLabelLayout
member.summary: Controls options related to data label layout on a per chart level.
member.remarks: This object is relevant for Cartesian, Polar and Radar charts.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NChartLabelLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NChartLabelLayout.EnableInitialPositioning
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether initial label positioning is enabled.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true the control automatically chooses an initial position for each label so that there are minimum overlaps. The layout selects one of positions that are proposed by the series that owns the label. In case this property is set to false, the default position is used for each label.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NChartLabelLayout.RemoveOverlappedLabels
member.summary: Gets or sets a property indicating whether labels that overlap after initial label positioning should be removed from display.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NChartLabelLayout.EnableLabelAdjustment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether label position adjustment is enabled.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true the control adjusts the label positions after the initial placement. Labels can be moved in any direction to avoid overlapping.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NChartLabelLayout.MaxLayoutItems
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of items (labels and obstacles) that can be processed by the automatic layout system.
member.remarks: If the number of layout items in the chart exceeds this value, automatic layout is not performed.

member.name: F:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NChartLabelLayout.NChartLabelLayoutSchema
member.summary: Reference to the label layout settings schema

member.name: F:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NChartLabelLayout.EnableInitialPositioningProperty
member.summary: Reference to the EnableInitialPositioning property

member.name: F:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NChartLabelLayout.RemoveOverlappedLabelsProperty
member.summary: Reference to the RemoveOverlappedLabels property

member.name: F:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NChartLabelLayout.EnableLabelAdjustmentProperty
member.summary: Reference to the EnableLabelAdjustment property

member.name: F:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NChartLabelLayout.MaxLayoutItemsProperty
member.summary: Reference to the MaxLayoutItems property

member.name: T:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayout
member.summary: Controls options related to data label layout on a per series level.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayout.EnableDataPointSafeguard
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether data points of this series are protected from being overlapped by labels.
member.remarks: If this property is set to false the data points of this series can be overlapped by data labels. Otherwise the data points protect their characteristic points (like min and max) from being overlapped.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayout.DataPointSafeguardSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of the safeguard area that protects data points from being overlaped by labels.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayout.LabelLocations
member.summary: Gets or sets an array that contains possible initial label locations that are used by the label layout system.
member.remarks: The locations are taken into account when the EnableInitialPositioning property of the chart's LabelLayoutSettings object is set to true and the UseLabelLocations property is set to true. If the initial label positioning is disabled for this chart or for this series, then the standard label location is used for each label, as specified by the relevant NDataLabelStyle object.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayout.UseLabelLocations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the initial locations in the LabelLocations collection should be used.
member.remarks: This property can enable or disable the initial label positioning on a per-series basis. If initial positioning is disabled the initial location of each label is specified by the respective NDataLabelStyle object.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayout.InvertLocationsForInvertedDataPoints
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether label locations should be inverted vertically for data points with inverted vertical orientation.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayout.OutOfBoundsLocationMode
member.summary: Specifies the treatment mode for locations that fall partially out of the plot bounds.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayout.InvertLocationsIfIgnored
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether proposed label locations should be inverted if all of them are outside the chart bounds and are ignored.

member.name: F:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayout.NSeriesLabelLayoutSchema
member.summary: Reference to the SeriesLabelLayoutSettings schema

member.name: F:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NSeriesLabelLayout.EnableInitialPositioningProperty
member.summary: Reference to the EnableInitialPositioning property

member.summary: Reference to the EnableDataPointSafeguard property

member.summary: Reference to the DataPointSafeguardSize property

member.summary: Reference to the LabelLocations property

member.name: T:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDockGaugeAxisAnchor
member.summary: Docks a gauge axis to one of the two gauge axis dock zones (Top or Bottom), thereby reducing the space avaialable for the gauge content.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDockGaugeAxisAnchor.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDockGaugeAxisAnchor.#ctor(Nevron.Nov.Chart.ENGaugeAxisDockZone)
member.summary: Initializer constructor

member.summary: Initializer constructor

member.summary: Initializer constructor

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDockGaugeAxisAnchor.#ctor(Nevron.Nov.Chart.ENGaugeAxisDockZone,System.Boolean,Nevron.Nov.Chart.ENScaleOrientation,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Initializer constructor

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDockGaugeAxisAnchor.DockZone
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis position (zone) the axis is placed into

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDockGaugeAxisAnchor.BeforeSpace
member.summary: Specifies spacing of the level before the other levels in the zone (if any)
member.remarks: This property takes effect only when the property CreateNewZoneLevel is set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDockGaugeAxisAnchor.AfterSpace
member.summary: Specifies spacing that should be leaved after the level of the axis before other levels are added in the zone.
member.remarks: This property takes effect only when the property CreateNewZoneLevel is set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDockGaugeAxisAnchor.CreateNewZoneLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this anchor will create a new zone level for the axis or use the last created one.
member.remarks: If there are no levels in the zone the anchor will always create a zone level. Note that the BeforeSpace and AfterSpace properties depend on the value of this property.

member.name: T:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NAngularScale
member.summary: Represents a scale configurator that will configure the scale to display angular values.
member.remarks: By default the scale will try to decorate the major ticks using a divisor step for the specified cycle length. For example if you specifiy 90 degrees for cycle length the steps that will be considered are 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 9, 10, 15, 18, 30, 45 and 90 as they represent the possible divisors of 90.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NAngularScale.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NAngularScale.CustomStep
member.summary: Specifies the major ticks custom step when the mode is set to CustomStep.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NAngularScale.CustomSteps
member.summary: Specifies the major ticks custom steps when the mode is set to CustomSteps.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NAngularScale.CustomMinorTicks
member.summary: Specifies the minor ticks when AutoMinor ticks is set to false

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NAngularScale.CustomMajorTicks
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of major ticks.
member.remarks: When the current axis scale is switched in manual major tick mode you can specify the values at which major ticks are displayed.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NAngularScale.CycleLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the cycle length of the scale.
member.remarks: The scale uses this enum to find a divisor suitable for this length. For angular scales this results in proper scale decoration on PI half, PI and 2 * PI.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NAngularScale.AngleUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle unit for scale decoration

member.summary: Represents a date time scale.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDateTimeScale.Origin
member.summary: Specifies the date/time of the major tick origin when the UseOrigin property is set to true.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDateTimeScale.CustomStep
member.summary: Specifies the time span step when the major tick mode is set to TimeSpan.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDateTimeScale.CustomSteps
member.summary: Specifies the time span steps when the major tick mode is set to TimeSpans.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NDateTimeScale.CustomMajorTicks
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of custom major ticks.
member.remarks: When the current axis scale is switched in manual major tick mode you can specify the values at which major ticks are displayed.

member.name: T:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NAutoScaleBreak
member.summary: Represents an automatic scale break, which will be applied if the data displayed on the axis breaks the threshold factor.

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NAutoScaleBreak.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NAutoScaleBreak.#ctor(System.Single)
member.summary: Initializer constructor

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NAutoScaleBreak.ThresholdFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold factor controlling when a break is generated
member.remarks: This property accepts values in the range (0, 1]. Smaller values reduce the distance between data points that is requied to generate a scale break, while bigger values increase it. For example if you set the threshold factor to 0.5 a scale break will occur if the maximum distance between data points exceeds half of the data points range.

member.name: P:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NAutoScaleBreak.MaxScaleBreakCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of breaks that this scale break can generate

member.name: T:Nevron.Nov.Chart.NContentScaleBreakPosition
member.summary: Represents a scale break position, which is determined according to the amount of data left on the sides of the scale break.
member.remarks: For example suppose you have 10 data items and the scale break is above 7 of them and below 3 of them. In this case the scale break position will be 70 percent from the scale length as this reflects the amount of data present in the left and right (top and bottom) parts of the scale. You may limit this percent by using the PercentRange property (by default set to [10, 90]). This is needed in order to avoid extreme cases where a scale break will be driven too close to the scale begin or end values thus diminishing the readability of the chart.
